dialog: Hi Medi, can you explain more about Hepatitis B?

Of course! Hepatitis B is a viral infection that affects the liver. It can be transmitted through contact with infected blood or body fluids, such as during unprotected sex or sharing needles. It can also be passed from an infected mother to her baby during childbirth. The virus can cause both acute and chronic liver disease.
What are the symptoms of Hepatitis B?
Symptoms can vary, but they may include fatigue, jaundice (yellowing of the skin and eyes), abdominal pain, loss of appetite, nausea, and vomiting. Some people may not experience any symptoms at all.
Is there a cure for Hepatitis B?

While there is no cure for Hepatitis B, there are treatment options available to manage the infection and reduce the risk of complications. It's important to work with your healthcare provider to develop a personalized treatment plan.
How can I prevent Hepatitis B?
Prevention measures include getting vaccinated, practicing safe sex, avoiding sharing needles or other drug paraphernalia, and using precautions when coming into contact with blood or body fluids.
